data.name: Prime Factorization
data.description:
Task: 

Find all prime factors of n and format them like this: 

(45)=> 3\*\*2 \* 5\*\*1

The prime factors of 45 are 3 and 5. 

The double asterisk is read as "to the power of". Single asterisk is a multiplication operator. 
The result after formating is equivalent to input n:
3\*\*2 \* 5\*\*1 = 45

The formattated output will be returned as a string as in these examples:

(6)=> "2\*\*1 * 3\*\*1"

(8)=> "2\*\*3"

(10)=> "2\*\*1 \* 5\*\*1"

(12)=> "2\*\*2 \* 3\*\*1"

(20)=> 2\*\*2 \* 5\*\*1

rules: 

Prime bases are in ascending order.

Prime bases are unique and not to be repeated. ie 5\*\*2 \* 5\*\*1 should be combined into 5\*\*3

return null if input is prime or less than 2.
